metadata.title: CVE-2020-7065 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In PHP versions 7.3.x below 7.3.16 and 7.4.x below 7.4.4, while usingmb_strtolower() function with UTF-32LE encoding, certain invalid stringscould cause PHP to overwrite stack-allocated buffer. This could lead tomemory corruption, crashes and potentially code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-7065` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.4 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu1.1
libphp7.4-embed - 7.4.3-4ubuntu1.1
php7.4 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu1.1
php7.4-bcmath - 7.4.3-4ubuntu1.1
php7.4-bz2 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu1.1
php7.4-cgi - 7.4.3-4ubuntu1.1
php7.4-cli - 7.4.3-4ubuntu1.1
php7.4-common - 7.4.3-4ubuntu1.1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: php7.4 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.4.3-4ubuntu1.1').
